ProgramSupport

Contains subroutines that can be used to query metadata about program status

Functions
IsProgramActive
call ProgramSupport.IsProgramActive(
&isProgActive
);

Query if a program is active in memory (in C.S. 1).  This does not necessarily mean it's executing.

Response Parameters
&isActive

TRUE if a program is active in memory, or FALSE if not.

IsProgramRunning
call ProgramSupport.IsProgramRunning(
&isProgExecuting
);

Query if a program is currently executing (in C.S. 1).

Response Parameters
&isProgExecuting

TRUE if a program is currently executing, or FALSE

IsProgramPaused
call ProgramSupport.IsProgramPaused(
&isProgPaused
);

Query if a program is currently paused and not executing.

Response Parameters
&isProgPaused

TRUE if a program is currently paused, or FALSE

StartProgram
call ProgramSupport.StartProgram(
programIndex,
programLine
);

Begin executing the specified program at the specified line

Parameters
programIndex

the program to execute

programLine

the line within the program to begin on

AbortPrograms
call ProgramSupport.AbortPrograms();

Preemptively end execution of any programs running (in C.S. 1).

PauseProgram
call ProgramSupport.PauseProgram();

Temporarily halt execution of the programs (in C.S. 1).  Executed by the 'Feed Hold' HMI button if a program is currently executing
